product_name: bareMineralsCOMPLEXION RESCUE Natural Matte Tinted Moisturizer Mineral SPF 30
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganHSA/FSA eligibleThe #1 Skin-Improving Tinted Moisturizer in the US* from bareMinerals now available in an oil-free, natural matte finish. Complexion Rescue Natural Matte Tinted Moisturizer Mineral SPF 30 creates a blurred, even complexion, perfect for oily and combination skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsInstantly delivers a natural matte finish for up to 12 hours of oil-control*Builds from sheer to light coverage for a natural matte finishClinically proven to improve skin texture by 36% in 1 week!*Protects against the sun damage with mineral-based SPF 30Perfect for oily and combination skin as well as sensitive, acne prone skinVisibly evens skin tone and blurs imperfectionsAvailable in 20 inclusive shades ‚Äì the same 20 shades as best-selling Complexion Rescue Tinted MoisturizerFeaturesClinically proven to instantly control oil for up to 12 hours*Clinically proven to instantly reduce shine by 67%*Clinically proven to instantly minimize oil breakthrough by 33%*Blurs the look of imperfections, pores, blemishes and redness**(*based on a clinical study of 34 panelists. Results may vary.)(**based on a consumer test of 36 people)Key IngredientsMarine Botanicals: Mineral-rich skin balancing ingredients reduce oil and sebum overtimeSqualene: Core of squalene and pigments, surrounded by mineral-infused water impart fast-absorbing, oil-free hydrationItem 2632935How To UsebareMinerals recommends applying with your fingertips. If brush is preferred, you can also apply with the Smoothing Face Brush (sold separately).SHAKE WELL before applying to incorporate the mattifying mineral powders uniformly and evenly into skin.Squeeze a pea size amount onto the fingertips.Apply beginning on the cheeks at the center of the face, blending outward.Work onto skin until the product is fully blended.Allow time to dry down to its natural matte finish.To build coverage where needed, press a small amount of product on with your fingertips.Pro Tips:Prep skin with bareMinerals skincare and/or primer based on your individual need. Allow to dry down before applying‚ÄØCOMPLEXION RESCUE Natural Matte Tinted Moisturizer.For those with drier skin types, they recommend COMPLEXION RESCUE Tinted Moisturizer SPF 30 for a‚ÄØhydration boost.Sun Protection Measures:Apply liberally 15 minutes before sun exposure.Children under 6 months of age: Ask a doctorSun Protection Measures: Spending time in the sun increases your risk of skin cancer and early skin aging. To decrease this risk, regularly use sunscreen with a Broad Spectrum SPF value of 15 or higher and other sun protection measures including: Limit time in the sun, especially from 10 a.m. - 2 p.m. Wear long-sleeved shirts, pants, hats, and sunglasses.Reapply at least every 2 hours.Use a water-resistant sunscreen if swimming or sweating.IngredientsActive Ingredients: Titanium Dioxide 6.9 %...Sunscreen.Water/Aqua/Eau, Titanium Dioxide, Coconut Alkanes, Propanediol, Silica, Squalane, Trehalose, Kaolin, Agar, Isostearic Acid, Polysorbate 60, Sorbitan Sesquiisostearate, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Salicornia Herbacea Extract, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Seed Extract, Camellia Japonica Flower Extract, Chlorella Vulgaris Extract, Polyglyceryl-4 Laurate/Succinate, Aluminum Hydroxide, Phenoxyethanol, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Glycerin, Hydrogen Dimethicone, Magnesium Stearate, Chlorphenesin, Cellulose Gum, Butylene Glycol, Succinoglycan, Lauroyl Lysine, Sodium Pca, 1,2-Hexanediol, Calcium Chloride, Magnesium Chloride, Biosaccharide Gum-4, Potassium Chloride, Melilotus Officinalis Extract, Magnesium Oxide, Lactic Acid, Alumina. May Contain (+/-) Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499), Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: bareMinerals recommends applying with your fingertips. If brush is preferred, you can also apply with the Smoothing Face Brush (sold separately).SHAKE WELL before applying to incorporate the mattifying mineral powders uniformly and evenly into skin.Squeeze a pea size amount onto the fingertips.Apply beginning on the cheeks at the center of the face, blending outward.Work onto skin until the product is fully blended.Allow time to dry down to its natural matte finish.To build coverage where needed, press a small amount of product on with your fingertips.Pro Tips:Prep skin with bareMinerals skincare and/or primer based on your individual need. Allow to dry down before applying‚ÄØCOMPLEXION RESCUE Natural Matte Tinted Moisturizer.For those with drier skin types, they recommend COMPLEXION RESCUE Tinted Moisturizer SPF 30 for a‚ÄØhydration boost.Sun Protection Measures:Apply liberally 15 minutes before sun exposure.Children under 6 months of age: Ask a doctorSun Protection Measures: Spending time in the sun increases your risk of skin cancer and early skin aging. reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Great product. Applied smooth. Great color match. I I'll buy again.

reviews.headline: Not my favorite!
reviews.comments: The Matte Complexion Rescue was recommended to me when the original was unavailable. Unfortunately, it didn't work for my skin. I found that it applied unevenly and left my skin feeling dry. I gave it two separate tries but experienced the same issues both times. Personally, I wouldn't repurchase or recommend this formula.

reviews.headline: Pass on this one...
reviews.comments:
I really like the whole Bare Minerals concept and products but the Complexion Rescue was a loser. I surf and am a youthful 40 something. This product gets one star cuz I have to give it one star and it went on easily with a good smell. The rest of the story is downhill. It really settles into any creases and leaves a hefty white-cast. I also thought it blended in well but within an hour I could see swirly areas that were not bendable at that point.

Also, it is just dry dry dry. No moisture level. I guess if you have super oily skin this could work but otherwise it will dry your skin out like a day in the desert. No bueno! 

I thought this product would be the answer after giving the famous/infamous ILIA skin tint a two year run but NO. The search goes on. By the end of the day this product was settled into all the wrong places and made my face look chalky and (did I already say) DRY! I needed a thick moisturizer the next day. All in all the Complexion Rescue was a complexion destroyer for this surfer girl. Bye-bye!

reviews.headline: Bare Minerals Complexion Rescue Natural
reviews.comments:
It feels very nice on my skin. 
I love it

reviews.headline: I love the Coverage!!!
reviews.comments: The color is darker on the container than it actually is, but once blend it looks like a match.  I also set it with powder.  I think I will purchase another shade in the near future.  I do like how it covers and blend so easily.

reviews.headline: Good color match but more shiny than matte
reviews.comments: This was my first attempt to replace another tinted moisturizer with sunscreen I really liked, but has been discontinued.  The color matches my skin tone fine but my face looks shiny immediately after applying it.  My skin was very oily when I was younger, but this happens right after washing my face and applying nothing else beforehand.  I will use it until it's gone, but my search continues for a tinted moisturizer with sunscreen.

reviews.headline: NOT for oily skin
reviews.comments:
Oily skin girlies this is not for us. The second i put this on it dried almost immediately, couldnt blend it at all. Very very dry and patchy. 

Ive always loved bare minerals products vut this one was very disappointing.

reviews.headline: Excellent for aging skin
reviews.comments: Got tired of all makeup- all of it seemed to make me look older and accentuate the lines. This gives me even skin color and a very natural look. It doesn't fill in or sink into lines. Like this because it's also good for my skin

reviews.headline: Love
reviews.comments: Never used matte finish before. The associate suggested this for summer and helped me find the correct shade. Looks amazing all day long. Highly recommend for summer

reviews.headline: Beautiful
reviews.comments: Perfect shade match, natural matte coverage that lasts all day. Feels like nothing on the skin!

reviews.headline: The original but better for combination skin!!
reviews.comments: I've been using the original for 3 years now, I have combination skin and loooove the shade but it would get pretty oily. This is the upgrade girls!! It's so much better and may be called matte but definitely gives you a little dewy look as well

reviews.headline: Very disappointed
reviews.comments: Bought this because I've been on the hunt for a new skin tint. I saw all the glowing recommendations everywhere I turned while doing my research. It didnt even last a few hours. I have oily/combo skin so I chose the matte over the glowy one. It enlarged my pores, dried unevenly, and was patchy when putting it on. Even with shaking and using a brush to blend. It transferred so easily too. It was pilling off not long after I applied it. I was disappointed during the entire application process. If I could give it a 0 I would.

reviews.headline: Lightweight
reviews.comments: I had high hopes for this product. I purchased it in hopes of being able to achieve a "no makeup" look. I have large pores so I tend to stray away from any type of liquid foundation type make up. If I'm being honest, I couldn't even get past how terrible and noticeable it made my pores, to even put a full face of this product on. It was lightweight but in ny opinion hard to blend.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again.
reviews.comments: Clean beauty and fragrance free products are important to me. I have Googled lots and lots of various well-known brands, and have tried several. Bare Minerals remain my favorite after many years!

reviews.headline: AMAZING when used with a brush!
reviews.comments: I had bought both the normal and matte complexion rescues last year, trying to get away from foundations. I wasn't overly impressed. Poor coverage and got kind of weird. Fast forward to now, I'm once again trying to stop with actual foundation, and this time I tried applying both with a liquid foundation brush instead and oh my god THAT was the key!!! They go on SO much better, cover more and act like a foundation without the heaviness of a foundation. AND now my pores look more blurred and it doesn't settle into creases. TOTAL GAME CHANGER.

reviews.headline: This is the first foundation product I've ever returned
reviews.comments: I have been using bareMinerals Complexion Rescue for many years. Like others, I was happy to see a less shiny option and purchased the Matte version in my usual color -- Wheat 4.5.  It's no where near the same color -- it's at least two shades darker and VERY orange. Totally unwearable. And it's difficult to apply (I used a foundation brush.)  Yes, I shook it very well before using.

reviews.headline: Cakey
reviews.comments: My skin didn't absorb the product it was cakey i don't recommend this product üëéüèª

reviews.headline: Just awful.
reviews.comments: Having loved the other version of their tinted moisturizer I opted for this version after my tried and true item was out of stock. HUGE MISTAKE. This product was the worst. It was streaky and bunched up in random parts of my face. I hate it. Don't waste your money or time on this item.

reviews.headline: I tried but this product is strange
reviews.comments: As an oily face woman, I wanted to love this product. Like so many others, as soon as it hit my skin, it just dragged across, I couldn't get it to glide on in any smooth manner. I read a tip to mix with your moisturizer to apply, but that didn't work. I also read a tip that said not to use any serums underneath, that didn't work either. I don't get this product and could never get it to not drag across my face so I did return it.

reviews.headline: I love it!
reviews.comments: I really don't like foundation or even tinted moisturizers, because they feel uncomfortable on my skin. But this matte Complexion Rescue is wonderful. It looks like my natural skin tone but more even. It doesn't feel heavy or oily‚Ä¶it just feels like my normal skin. And the SPF is not irritating. Great stuff!

faceoff_positive.comments: I have used and loved the original Complexion Rescue since it's release several years ago, but as an oily-skinned lady,  I longed for a less "radiant" finish.  Finally, BareMinerals has heard us!!!  I was so excited about this product, I started using it before I finished my current tube of the original.  My initial reaction was that the matte finish didn't blend as well or apply as smoothly.  Then I started reading reviews, to see if I was alone.  Lo and behold, I realized that this product is supposed to be shaken before application.  I looked at the packaging again, expecting to see this in the directions; nope.  The teeny, tiny text about shaking before use is located beneath the color name.  Please, please, please...make this larger and part of the directions for use.  Some of us have older eyes and can't see or read that teeny, tiny text without assistance.  Once I started shaking the tube before applying, the matte version applies just as smoothly as the original, without that awful radiant (aka shiny) finish!  TL;DR Love, love, love this for an oily complexion, but BareMinerals really needs to fix the packaging so the "shake well" instructions are a readable font size and part of the directions for use.
faceoff_positive.headline: Finally a matte option!!!

faceoff_negative.comments: This is a matte-tinted moisturizer containing mineral sunscreen. It grabs onto any and all dry areas of the face. It doesn't play well with certain primers. (I highly recommend staying away from gripping primers!) I had good results with Benefits Porefessional however. If you have visible pores a pore-filling primer would do wonders because this skin tint has the tendency to sink into them.   Application is difficult. It has a soft mousse-y texture. Not too thick, like spackle, but not so easy to blend. You're supposed to shake it well before applying but I don't find that really helps with some of the separations of the pigments. I don't know if that's caused by the mineral sunscreen but you have to blend extra hard or you'll end up with a streaky mess. A damp beauty blender made the product pill and just looked odd on my face. (It gathered and bunched up. So strange.) A dry sponge applied it okay but used up a lot of product. Denser brushes applied it the best but I still had to pounce a dry sponge over my face to help get rid of brush strokes.   Coverage is light. It doesn't feel heavy on the skin. I didn't have any issues with applying my concealer or face powders. While the initial application is rough, letting the makeup set for a while makes it look 20x better. An hour after I do my face it looks pretty dang good and I forget about my earlier struggles. And it wears quite well. I wore it for 10 hours the other day, with a mask on, and most of the makeup stayed put and I didn't get too greasy.  The shade I received was a little dark but despite all my complaints I want to go find and buy a better shade match. I see myself still using it as the weather gets nice and warm.
faceoff_negative.headline: A confusing product (I'd still buy)
